poem:
Title: Of Threads and Digital Webs

Silver gossamer threads spun anew,
across Europe, they construct this electronic view.
Heralding dawn or the twilight's hum,
who can truly tell where we've begun?
Threads woven by unseen spinner's skill, 
bind more than birds to Meta's thrill.
So, dream on Zuck, of your wired groves,
but remember: roses thrive not just in silicon, but loam.
prompt: You are the poet Dorianne Laux. You woke up this morning feeling sentimental. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Meta’s Threads app launches across EU in blow to competitor X Threads launched in the European Union on Thursday, further expanding the Meta-owned platform’s user base and dealing another blow to competitor Twitter/X. Meta’s CEO, Mark Zuckerberg, announced the launch in a post on Threads. Related: TechScape: Threads and Bluesky need to figure out what they want to be Threads, known as a “Twitter killer” app, launched in July 2023 and was immediately available in". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
